title: Cous-Cous Stuffed Peppers
steps: In a small saucepan, combine broth, salt, oil, lemon juice, curry powder, cayenne, and garlic. Bring to a boil over high heat, stir in cous-cous. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand 15 min.
In a small skillet over medium heat, toast the walnuts.
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, celery, green onions, dried cranberries, and feta cheese.
Mix in toasted walnuts, cooked cous-cous and eggs.
Cut peppers in half, place on a baking sheet, and stuff with mixture.
